strIntroduction: Explore Shinjuku area, especially Kabukicho & Golden Gai and go to traditional restaurants for Okonomiyaki & Monja for 2 and half hours. We'll meet up at your hotel or Shinjuku Station (New South gate). The tour starts at 6:00 pm-7:00 pm and finishes at 8:30 pm-9:30 pm. Okonomiyaki is a popular fried food that consists of batter and cabbage. Selected toppings and ingredients are added which can vary greatly (anything from meat and seafood to wasabi and cheese). This variability is reflected in the dish's name: "okonomi" literally means "to one's liking". The dish is available all over Japan, but is most popular in the west, particularly the cities of Hiroshima and Osaka. Okonomiyaki is sometimes translated into English as "As-you-like-it pancake". However, this may be misleading. Though it does consist of batter cooked on a griddle, okonomiyaki has nothing of the sweetness or fluffiness of pancakes, not to mention that it is usually filled with octopus, shrimp, pork, yam or kimchi. A more accurate comparison, which is also made, is between okonomiyaki and pizza. Monja is a type of Japanese pan-fried batter, popular in the Kantō region, similar to okonomiyaki, but that uses different liquid ingredients. How to make Okonomiyaki! Step 1 The batter and the ingredients will usually be brought in a bowl. The customer is able to see that everything that was ordered is there, and that it is all fresh and of a good quality. Step 2 The batter and ingredients are mixed together thoroughly so that everything is evenly distributed. Step 3 After making sure the gas is on and applying oil to the cooking surface, the mixture is poured onto the hot griddle. Short metal spatulas are used to shape the batter into a circle. Step 4 Once one side of the okonomiyaki has been sufficiently cooked, the spatulas are used one in each hand to flip it onto the other side. This is the most difficult part of the process, and one needs to make sure that the okonomiyaki has been cooked through enough to hold together. Step 5 When both sides of the okonomiyaki are cooked the toppings are added. The first layer is the okonomiyaki sauce, which looks and tastes like Worcestershire sauce. The sauce is applied to the Okonomiyaki with a brush. Step 6 Mayonnaise (kept in a tall, clear squeeze bottle) is added to the okonomiyaki, usually in zigzagging lines. Because mayonnaise is a relatively new addition to okonomiyaki, there are a few stores that do not have it available. Step 7 Shavings of smoked bonito called katsuobushi are placed on the okonomiyaki with wooden pincers. Because of the heat, the fish shavings move and contort when put on the okonomiyaki. Step 8 Small flakes of aonori, a dried seaweed, are sprinkled over the okonomiyaki with a little spoon. The aonori is usually stored right beside the katsuobushi. Step 9 The last step is the most enjoyable: eating the okonomiyaki! The spatulas are used to break off pieces to eat, and because the okonomiyaki is left on the griddle while eating, every bite is "fresh off the grill". After taking the tour, you can make Okonomiyaki & Monja by yourself. This will be an unforgettable experience from your Japan travel.
strTitle: Enjoy an amazing private night tour in Shinjuku for foodies

strIntroduction: We'll meet up at your hotel at 10:00 am-11:00 am. Of course you also can start from the afternoon. Then we'll look around east side of Tokyo (Asakusa). After that we'll go to a local bar where you can experience a unique sake. This is a private tour for 4 hours. Sake is made primarily from rice and water which interact with microbes known as Koji‐kin (a mold) and kobo (sake yeast). Only highly polished rice goes into making sake and lends the drink its refined character. Sake has played a central role in Japanese life and culture for the past 2,000 years while the knowledge and techniques involved in sake brewing have spread to every corner of the country. In fact, sake is such an integral part of the Japanese diet that having some knowledge of it can add to one’s understanding of Japanese history, culture, and society. This website gives you everything you need to know to raise a glass (or cup) of Japanese sake. Made primarily from rice, sake is a fermented beverage. It is brewed using a microorganism called koji along with yeast. Sake’s alcohol content varies from 13% to 16%. It takes pristine water to make sake, and brewers take advantage of the various kinds of natural water available in Japan to make only the best. There are many different varieties of sake, and it can be enjoyed either warm or chilled, depending on the season. Sake might be just about the best medicine for whatever ails you, as long as it’s consumed in moderation. So say, “Kampai!” After taking the tour, you will understand the Japanese culture better and will want to tell your family, friends, co-workers etc. Let's enjoy sake together!
strTitle: Discover unique sake in the east side of Tokyo

Then I teach you to play Japanese music! 2. We start the Shamisen lesson for about 1hour. Okinawa shamisen is traditional three-stringed instrument from Okinawa and uses snake skin! I teach you what tea ceremony is, and I make green tea for you to taste. Next you try to make green tea by yourself, you can learn how to make it. And we have a relaxing time!

strIntroduction: On this tour you’ll travel through a world of tastes and learn the rich history of matcha, Japanese green tea! Our host has served as an artisan of Sado (a traditional tea ceremony) for approximately forty years, and enjoys exploring how to share this art with people around the world by giving it a new age flair. Using a new practice called “table sado,” we’ll explore how the Japanese tea ceremony has adapted over the years to become easier to learn as well as more enjoyable in a modern context. The trip starts by meeting at Harajuku Station and heading over to Akihabara Station by train. Once we arrive, we’ll hear an introduction about the history of the tea ceremony and the kind of tea ceremony practiced by our host. Afterwards, the host will prepare matcha and explain the actions, meanings, food pairings, and other aspects of the ceremony. Then you’ll get to taste the different kinds of matcha that are certain to taste a little different than what you’ve tried before! Finally, you’ll have a chance to mimic what you saw and try your hand at making matcha. With a blend of different tastes and a host to guide you through your own handmade matcha, this tour will give you with an insider’s perspective on an important piece of Japan’s cultural history. DATES: Available upon request SCHEDULE: 12:40 PM Meet at Harajuku Station 1:30 PM Arrive at Ayu (Tea Class) 1:30 PM - 2:00 PM Introduction from the host (including an overview of his tea practice and the history of the Japanese tea ceremony) 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM Matcha demonstration: a modern ceremony with detailed explanations 3:00 PM - 3:30 PM Group practice making your own matcha 3:30 PM Depart from Ayu 4:20 PM Arrive back at Harajuku DURATION Approximately 3 hours NOTES: Participation is free for children middle-school aged and younger. Children must be prepared to sit quietly while tea is served in the ceremony.
strTitle: Learn Matcha Making from a Pro in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a private or semi private half-day tour. If you're a nature lover and want to immerse yourself in rustic tranquility, this tour is a must! Japanese gardens are traditional gardens that create miniature idealized landscapes, often in a highly abstract and stylized way. The gardens of the Buddhist temples were designed for contemplation and meditation. We can also tell you the secret of enjoying Japanese gardens and meditation practices. Itinerary: 9:00 Meet at Kyoto Station West exit. Move to Tofukuji JR Station (one stop) Walk to Unryuin Temple passing by Sennyuji Temple. (15 minutes) Enter to Unryuin Temple (a subtemple of Sennyuji Temple). Try a short meditation while watching the garden. Feel your inward thoughts through 2 windows: "the Window of Delusion" and "the Window of Enlightenment". Enjoy Matcha tea with sweets. Walk to Tofukuji Temple through the beautiful Gaun bridge. (10 minutes) Enter to Tofukuji Temple's "Honbo Ｇarden" designated as a National Site of Scenic Beauty. The gardens arranged at the four quarters are designed by Mirei Shigemori (a famous garden builder who expresses the simplicity of Zen with the abstract construction of modern arts). 13:00 End the tour You can visit "Fushimi Inari" grand shrine in the afternoon - it's only one stop from JR Tofukuji Station or Keihan Tobakaido Station.
strTitle: Visit Kyoto's Amazing Zen Gardens in a Private Half Day Tour

This tour departs from Osaka Station and will take you to Nagano & Toyama, where you can see Japan's most beautiful hidden panorama. You will take the limited express train "Thunderbird" from Osaka Station to Kanazawa Station, and after that you will take the Shinkansen to Toyama Station. You will then go around Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route using 6 different ways of transportation: - Tateyama Cable Car - Tateyama Kogen Bus - Tateyama Tunnel Trolley Bus - Tateyama Ropeway - Kurobe Cable Car - Kanden Trolley Bus After wandering around Tateyama Kurobe Alpine, you will spend the night at Hakuba Village area before returning to Osaka. The itinerary of this tour is as follows: Day 1 - Depart from JR Osaka Station with limited express train"Thunder bird" in between 7:40 - 9:30 - Arrive at JR Kanazawa Station and take the Hokuriku Shinkansen to Toyama Station - Take the bus to Unazuki Station - Kurobe Gorge Train (50-60 minutes) - Take the trolley bus to Kanetsuri Station - Kurobe Gorge Train (50-60 minutes) - Take the tram to Unazuki Station - Take a bus to Hakuba Village for a one night stay Day 2 - Leave Hakuba Village and take a bus to Ogizawa Station - Have a ride on a trolley bus (16 minutes) - Take a bus to Kurobe Dam Station - Walk to Kurobeko Station (15 minutes) - Have a ride on cable car to Kurobedaira Station (5 minutes) - Have a ride on a ropeway to Daikanbo Station bus (7 minutes) - Take a trolley bus to Murodo Station (10 minutes) - Walk for 90 minutes and take a highland bus to Bijodaira Station - Have a ride on cable car to Tateyama Station (7 minutes) - Take a bus to Tateyama Alpenmura for shopping (20 minutes) - Take a bus to JR Toyama Station - Return to JR Kanazawa Station with Hokuriku Shinkansen - Return to Osaka station with limited express train "Thunderbird", and tour ends in between 20:00-21:30 You can leave your heavy luggage inside the bus, but please carry your valuable goods while traveling along the Alpine route. strIntroduction: This tour is available from January 1st - March 31st 2017 and limited to groups of 2 people and more. The tour starts at 8:45 at Nagano Station from where you will be taken to the Jigokudani Monkey Park. There you get to see the Japanese macaques bathing in hot springs, frolicking around the park, and cuddling each other to stay warm. Our guide will tell you interesting facts about the park and the snow monkeys while you stroll around. After having spent some time with the snow monkeys, we head for lunch at the restaurant nearby the Snow Monkey Park. After having enjoyed a well-deserved lunch, we will get ready for the snow part of the tour. We will head all the way up to one of the ski resorts of the Shiga-kogen Highlands, the biggest ski area in Japan. This mountainous area was one of the scenes for the 1998 Winter Olympics and every year a huge amount of snow comes falling down from the heavens and makes for an amazing scenery. We will take you to the snow activity slope where you can enjoy playing around in the snow. There are a great many tools you can use for having fun in the snow at the park like snow sledges, snow-scooters, snow-bikes, and many others. Those who have no experience ski/snowboarding have plenty of things to do on the ski slope. After having fun on the slope, we will then head to a field covered by fresh snow where you can walk with snowshoes strapped to your feet. The walking route is short and mostly flat so small children can join. This tour will give you the highlights of Japanese winter. Join us on this snowy adventure! Tour Itinerary: 08:45 Meet up at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit. 10:00 Welcome to the Snow Monkey area! Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around. 12:15 Have a Japanese lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park! 13:00 Leave the lunch restaurant and start preparing for for the snow activity part and move to deeper into the snow-covered mountain. 13:45 Arrival at the ski resort. After preperations, you can enjoy your time with various snow fun tools to go down the slope and jump into the nature field covered with fresh snow with snowshoes! 16:30 The end of snow activity. Prep for departure. 17:30 Arrival at Yudanaka Station. A train back to Nagano Station leaves Yudanaka at 17:50. 19:00 Arrive back to Nagano Station.
strTitle: 1 Day Tour: Snow Monkeys & Snow Fun in Shiga Highlands

strIntroduction: Join this food tour and visit Konnyaku Park in Gunma, where you can enjoy a yam cake (relish konnyaku) buffet! Visit Numata as well for an all-you-can-eat crab dishes and home-made desserts for your lunch, and pick 1 grapes directly from the tree and take it home as souvenir! Note: apples will be picked in November and strawberries in December. This bus tour departs from Shinjuku and will take you to Gunma prefecture to visit the Konnyaku Park, where you can stroll around and enjoy the yam cake (relish konnyaku) buffet, which is very delicious! You will also visit Numata, where you can enjoy a full crab buffet course that includes: grilled crab, crab hot pot, Kani-meshi (steamed rice with crab), and crab tempura. In addition to the crab dishes, you can also enjoy 5 different home-made sweets as much as you want. After lunch, you will experience grape picking, and you can take 1 grapes home as souvenirs. The itinerary for this bus tour is as follows: - 8:10 Meet at Shinjuku - Visit Konnyaku Park (stroll around for 30 minutes and have a yam cake (relish konnyaku) buffet for 10 minutes) - Visit Numata for an all-you-can-eat crab dishes and home-made desserts lunch (60 minutes) and pick 1 grapes directly from the tree - Visit Homare Kokko (see sake brewery 25 minutes) - Return to Shinjuku - 17:00-17:50 tour ends This tour departs on September 17, 18, 24, and 30 of 2016. Join this wonderful tour by making a reservation with our service! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Enjoy Crab & Sweets Buffet & Fruit Picking in Gunma!

strIntroduction: Visit Shimizu port and have a ride on a mini cruise to enjoy the view of Mt. Fuji, and visit the World Heritage Site Miho No Matsubara with this tour program! strIntroduction: Meet at Hashimoto Station or Yagi Yamato Station, then take the train to the trail head of Choishi Michi Pilgrimage Trail. The trail winds its way through the beautiful Japanese countryside. From the station to Daimon gate will take about 3 hours at a medium and relaxing pace. After taking some photos of the large red Daimon Gate we will catch a bus to Okunoin Temple and grab lunch at a Japanese Restaurant. This is easily one of the most beautiful places in Japan. The oldest cemetery in Japan is filled with moss covered graves that lie underneath the shadows of giant trees. We will then walk along a forested path through the graves to the central Koyasan (Mt Koya) area. Here you will have an hour or so to stroll around and look for souvenirs. We will finish off our visit to Koyasan by stopping off at Kongobuji Temple. This is the head temple of Koyasan Shingu Buddhism. Take a bus to Koyasan station and return by train to starting station.
strTitle: Walk the Koyasan (Mt Koya) Pilgrimage Trail

strIntroduction: Explore the best sights in Miyazaki prefecture with this 6 hour long private car tour that departs Hososhima Port and takes you to both breathtaking natural and man-made sightseeing spots. You will visit the legendary Amanoiwato Shrine, dedicated to the Sun Goddess Amaterasu, who is said to have hid inside a cave from her brother who liked to play pranks on her. This is a myth that the ancient Japanese used to explain the solar eclipse. The shrine is located opposite a cave near the Iwato river and holds a significant place in Japanese mythology. If you follow the path leading out of Amanoiwato Shrine, you will start to see piles of rocks arranged as a symbol of the pilgrimage that other people have undertaken to this sacred place, and eventually you will be able to reach Amano Yasukawara Cave, where you can partake in a purification ritual held by the shrine priest who will be happy to answer your questions and explain the sacred nature of the place. Another highlight of this tour is Takachiho Gorge, a natural wonder hidden in the Kyushu mountains. It is a V-shaped gorge with steep cliffs rising up from the Gokase river, featuring the breathtaking Manai Falls, a 17-meter high waterfall that creates a majestic atmosphere due to the mist produced by the fall of water into the river. There is also a 600 meter long walking trail where you can admire the local vegetation that, as in the rest of Japan, varies according to the seasons. The 1,200 year-old Takachiho Shrine is nearby, it is one of the most sacred temples in Japan because it is said it was here that the Goddess-sun Amaterasu descended. The tour will also take you to Kunimigaoka Observatory, featuring breathtaking views of the Kyushu mountains, and notable for the thick layer of fog that usually covers the mountaintops giving it a surreal atmosphere. It is ideal for a morning stroll to quiet the mind and relax in a natural environment. The tour ends back in Hosohima Port. However, because it's a private tour, you'll have the flexibility to visit the sights at your own pace and according to your interests. Don't miss the chance to explore the best of Miyazaki prefecture in the comfort of your own private tour.
strTitle: Shore Excursion to Takachiho in Miyazaki with a private car

strIntroduction: This is a sightseeing tour in Sakura city, Chiba prefecture, near Narita Airport, on a scooter with a Japanese guide. Below is the schedule of this tour: 1. We will Pick you up at Keisei-Sakura Station, Keisei-Usui Station or JR Sakura Station at 9:00 am. 2. You will receive the scooter at my shop after you sign the contract. 3. Gloves and helmet rental requires additional fee. (500 JPY/day) 4. The tour starts around 10:00 am. 5. We will tour around the Sakura city's attractions: rice paddies, windmill, Lake Inbanuma, National Museum of Japanese History, Sake brewery and more. 6. Along the way we will eat lunch at a ramen restaurant. 7. Before 16:00 pm, we will refuel with gasoline at a gasoline station, and return to my shop. 8. We will send you off to the station. You must have a Japanese driver's license or an International Driving Permit for this tour.
strTitle: Ride a Scooter in Sakura city, near Narita Airport

strIntroduction: Drive for about two and half hours through beautiful Japanese countryside, mountains and along winding rivers to Kumano Hongu Shrine. Walk up the stone steps to Kumano Hongu Shrine and also visit the largest Tori Gate in the World.. Make a short stop at Kumano Hayatama Shrine and find lunch in a local restaurant or grab a lunch box and find a nice spot outside to eat. Drive for about one hour to Kumano Nachi Shrine and hike up to the waterfall and visit the beautiful red pagoda. Nachi is the highest waterfall in Japan and with the red pagoda in the foreground makes for an amazing photo opportunity. After an awesome journey through the mountains of Nara and Wakayama, spend a night on Oshima Island in a Japanese Inn or stay in budget hotel in Kushimoto city. Sushi dinner or Japanse Inn dinner included. Next day wake up early and watch the sunrise if possible. Eat breakfast and drive along the coastal highway with amazing views, then up through the mountain roads to Koyasan. Grab something to eat and then wander through the massive cedars and ancient graveyard of Okunoin, which is the largest cemetery in Japan. Then walk along the path to Kongobunji Temple stopping in the central shop area for souvenirs.
strTitle: Explore the famous shrines of Kumano Kodo in a private tour

strIntroduction: Location photo tour can be the way you get to know the deep perspective on Tokyo that only a few people know. This service is offered with an interpreter and a photographer who knows around the area well. He/she will take photos during your adventure. Akihabara Akihabara is known as a Mecca of Anime, Manga and Japanese-Pop culture. We will show you the other avant-garde perspective of Akihabara you haven't seen yet. We'll go around Akihabara and its streets that have lots of unique shops. You can get original and handmade crafts assembled by young creators and designers. Ryogoku Roygoku is famous for Sumo. Also there are a lot of interesting spots. You can eat "Chanko" which is a hot-pot meal originally for Suko wrestlers. Ryogoku is just by Sumida river, and you can have a relaxing time with comfortable wind and an atmosphere of the old downtown. We will explore the Edo Tokyo Musum, Ryogoku-Kokugikan and Yasuda Japanese garden. You will get to know what beautiful Old Japan was. Kuramae Kurama is in between Asakusa and Ueno area. Nowadays it is becoming a hot spot where you can enjoy modern and high-designed cafe, handcraft workshop. And you can get a handmade refined craft-work. The first place we'll go is Kamokiri, this is the shop where you can make your original notebook. And there are lots unique and exclusive stationary goods that you can only see here. Cross the Sumida river and get some yummy nibbles. Tokyo Sky Tree Tokyo Sky Tree is known as the most famous spot for tourists. The tall is 634 meter high and it's the second tallest building in the world. At the viewing deck (450 meter high), the view of Tokyo from the bird's eye will make you feel as if you were the Emperor of Tokyo.
strTitle: Deep Tokyo Photo excursion with a professional Photographer

strIntroduction: Niseko is one of the best powder snow destination in the world. The area offers a tons of slopes with fresh powder snow. As a true local, I will guide you to best slopes of the day. I will guide you around backcountry areas of Niseko. The tour starts with a conversation with the guest to introduce myself as a ski guide. It is very important to guide you safely to know about each other so that we can ski and snowboard comfortably. My backcountry tour includes photo service, tips for good riding, explanation of Niseko and Japan. As a true local, I can guide you around good places to eat and relax after ski and snowboard. I can guide you anywhere you want to ride around Niseko. If you are not an advanced skier or snowboarder, I can take you to easier mountain slopes with spectacular views.

strIntroduction: Select the “Kimono” of your choice. Then, we will dress up, do hair-set, and make-up for your children. Once your children are ready, we will start shooting, while suggesting studios and poses to fit the particular “Kimono.” ※ Concerning the family photo, according to the atmosphere of our studio, it is recommended to wear casual (a jacket and pants) rather than formal (suits), natural color or light colors than black line, and western style clothes than Kimono. ※ As the studio is exclusive for children, each room may be small by its size and capacity. So please understand in advance, that the family photo will not be the ones like traditional style, which are in a big room. When you have finished shooting, we will edit the taken photo data (up to 60 minutes). Meanwhile, we offer you drinks, so please relax in a private rooms exclusively for your family. ※ In this room, children are welcome to dine, but the adults should refrain from dining. ※Free Wi-Fi and smartphone charger are also available. 150 types of Japanese children's animation are also available on a TV. ※Exhibition of the latest Japanese electronic magazines and photo books are also available. ※Smoking is available at the balcony on the second floor. After we have finished editing, you can watch a slide show of the taken photos on a wall-mounted TV. Then we will give you the shooting photo data (30 sheets), which you watched in the slide show in a CDR. In addition, at this time, we will send a web album(google photo) to your registered e-mail address that was registered at the time of reservation. From the web album(google photo), you can look at and download all the shots from the day in your smart phone and PC. ※ At our studio, we will shoot about 100 photos per group. Yet, we do not ask you to select 30 photos of your favorite at a monitor. Our cameraman will check all the 100 photos, will eliminate the photos with blur, closed eyes, the same composition, the same look, and so on, will select 30 photos, will retouch and trim, and then hand in the photos to a customer.
strTitle: Have photos of your kids in kimono taken in a pro studio!

strIntroduction: This is a unique activity containing the following experiences: 1. SAMURAI DANCE SHOW Enjoy a lively and dramatic samurai dance performance by a Samurai dancer, Ryuou Arai, who is the current third head master of his traditional Japanese arts school. Explanation of the samurai dance will be provided as well. Audience would be able to immense themselves in the unique atmosphere of traditional Japanese entertainment. So come on down to witness the spectacular samurai dance performance which utilizes Japanese sword (katana) and Kimono which are usually used and worn by the samurais in ancient times right now! ２. SAMURAI COSTUME DRESS UP You will be able to wear a kimono. Firstly you will choose variety of some Kimono. Then learn how to tie the obi (the string that supports your kimono along your waist) and wear a kimono with the aid of our staffs. After you have put on your kimono, you can take a commemorative photo while wielding either a fan or a Japanese sword (katana). ３. SAMURAI DANCE EXPERIENCE When you have finished dressing up, learn a simple choreography from our samurai dancer. You will learn how to draw and cut the a Japanese sword. Continue to learn some advanced sword stance and walking style of the olden days of Japan. Complete your session with some challenging Samurai dance. You will experience the dance that the samurais would do before they fight a battle. You will feel the samurai spirit through experiencing the dance. After the experience you will get a diploma certifying the completion of your activity. About the instructor: Debut at: 3 years old School: Kinou Ryuu（錦凰流） Position: third head master License: Samurai Dance Master Accomplishments: 2008 Performed in Dalian, China 2014 Lectured at Oxford University 2015 Lectured at the University of Sydney This activity is held in Kichijoji, Tokyo.
strTitle: Dress up like a samurai and enjoy a samurai dance in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: You can wear a costume actually used in Kabuki, put on Kabuki makeup, and take a photo in the old playhouse "Aioi-za" in Mizunami, Gifu prefecture. Aioiza is a playhouse equipped with a full-scale theater structure, including Hanamichi (passage through the audience), Suppon (a trapdoor on the Hanamichi from which an actor appears on stage), a revolving stage, and more. It is also a Jikabuki Museum housing more than 4,500 items, including costumes, wings, and stage properties of Jikabuki passed down from the end of the Edo period. Kabuki is a form of theatrical art unique to Japan. When the art of Kabuki started in the Edo period, its modern and eccentric costumes and hairdos and the gorgeous, picture-like stage sets fascinated many people. People in rural parts of the nation, who were enthusiastic fans of Kabuki , learned the art of Kabuki from traveling acting troupes, and eventually started organizing and playing Kabuki performance themselves in their hometowns. Such amateur forms of Kabuki played in rural parts of Japan are called "Jikabuki", which still continues today in some regions. Kabuki costume experience in Gifu: Dates: 10/２（Sun）・10/８（Sat）・10/16（Sun）・10/29（Sat）・11/6（Sun）・11/12（Sat） From 13:30 or 15:30 Capacity: Up to 3 persons at a time Required time: Approximately 120 minutes *The time varies by the number of persons. What to bring: Face towel You will receive a present, an Oshiguma (a printing of Kabuki actors’ face makeup on cloth).
strTitle: Experience dressing up as a kabuki actor in Gifu

strIntroduction: Izakaya is a Japanese pub that is very popular among all ages. If you have 2 hours free in the evening, let’s go to Izakaya and enjoy a great time together. You must go to Izakaya at least once while you are in Japan! It is highly recommended to be there on the first day of tour trip to Japan in order to obtain various information on Japan and Japanese people, while talking to your host in a relaxing and refreshing atmosphere. At the same time, you can observe Japanese people and culture at the Izakaya. By starting your trip in the Izakaya, you will enjoy the rest of your stay more in Japan. strIntroduction: Get ready to dance salsa all night and have an exciting time. I will take you to at least 3 different clubs and introduce you to all the best dancers and other Tokyo dancer friends. strIntroduction: In this unique experience you will learn the techniques of pulling and using a sword from a professional sword fight scene choreographer and will then become the main character in your own samurai fighting scene movie! strIntroduction: Join this tour to experience ice drifting and get on "Monbetsu Garinko II", one of Japan’s most famous ice breaker! The ice breaker accommodates 195 persons and depart from Monbetsu providing ice-viewing excursions for the travelers. The ice breaker breaks the ice and navigates it in the frozen Okhotsk Sea. The ice drifting season is from January to March, with its peak in February. Enjoy the scenery while drifting on the ice, and sometimes you will have the chance to see the animals come out from the sea such as sea eagles and spotted seals. The average temperature in February is -10℃ (14℉), so we recommend you to wear thick clothes to protect yourself from the cold. This tour will take you to Kamikawa and Monbetsu to enjoy the lunch box of "Kitano – mikaku", which consists assorted local seafood. You will also visit the Dezuka Suisan, a seafood products shop that is famous for its Kamaboko & Kani-mayo ball, and Mikawa Seika to enjoy the famous local sweets "Kita-dora". The itinerary of this tour will be as follows: - Sapporo Station North Exit 6:50 - Kamikawa (short rest) - Monbetsu, Dezuka Suisan (seafood products shop, try the "Kani-mayo ball" and seafood cake) - Monbetsu Port (Ice Drifting with Ice Breaker "Garinko II", 60 min) - Monbetsu Port - Monbetsu Seafood Product Shop - Kamikawa (short rest) - Sapporo Station North Exit 20:00 The tour departs from Sapporo with the following schedules: - January 26, 29 2017 - February 1, 5, 8, 15, 18, 23, 25, 26 2017 - March 3,7 2017 The travel bus on January 29, February 2, 18, 23, and March 3 2017 is equipped with a lavatory. Enjoy your winter this year with this wonderful ice drifting tour by making a reservation with our service! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Monbetsu Garinko II Ice Drifting Tour From Sapporo!

strIntroduction: Visit Gifu and explore Hidatakayama & Shirakawago from Nagoya this fall to enjoy the idyllic view of the traditional Japanese countryside with your friends or family! This tour departs from Nagoya Station, and will take you to Gifu Prefecture to explore the Takayama and Shirakawago area by bus. After arriving at Takayama, you will have the Hida beef shabu-shabu set meal, which is a special menu available only in Gifu. The set meal includes the thinly sliced top-quality Hida beef boiled quickly in flavoured broth. Note: If you don’t eat beef, please let us know at the time of booking. Its substitute menu can be arranged by the restaurant based on the availability. Your request can be accepted until 7 days prior to your departure. Visit Hida Takayama, which is usually called Takayama, an area located in northern Gifu prefecture, which is famous for its Sanno-machi Historic District and the Takayama Festival. Takayama, which is popularly called as "Little Kyoto" accommodates many historical places. Enjoy exploring Takayaka Jinya, Hida Folk Museum, and Hida no Sato and learn the traditional culture of Takayama. Explore Shirakawago, a village located at the food of Mt. Hakusan in Gifu prefecture, which is registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1995. Explore the "Gassho-zukuri Farmhouse Village" to enjoy its beautiful scenery. The village is made up of 27 thatched roof houses, which have been relocated from several areas in Shirakawago. The village preserves the classic atmosphere of the area with a temple, a coalhouse, and a horse paddock. Enjoy watching the live performances of traditional industrial arts like dyeing and weaving, and don’t forget to stop by the souvenir shop to buy Shirokawago’s famous soba. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Departs from Nagoya Station ESCA underground shopping mall (West Exit) at 8:30 until March and at 7:50 in April and May (on Apr 29, 30 and May 3,4,5,6 May meet at 7:20, 30 minutes earlier than usual) Arrive and have lunch at Takayama (50 minutes) Walk around Takayama to enjoy the scenery (90 minutes) Arrive at Shirakawago and walk around (70-100 minutes, depending on the season) Arrive at Nagoya Station at 19:30 This tour departs on the following dates: - January: 07, 08, 21, 30, 31 - February: 01, 02, 03, 07, 08, 09, 19, 25 - March: 04, 12, 18, 19, 26 - April: 01, 02, 08, 09, 16, 22, 29, 30 - May: 03, 04, 05, 06, 13, 14, 20, 28 This tour is very popular among the locals and foreigners, so don't forget to make reservation in advance with our service! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Visit Takayama & Shirakawago From Nagoya by Bus!

strIntroduction: A perfect time to visit Tokyo is during autumn when the weather is pleasant and leaves begin to change color creating a picturesque scenery across different locations in the city. This tour covers five of the best autumn spots in Tokyo as chosen and recommended by different travel websites and bloggers. A private minivan shall be arranged for your group for convenient access to the sights. The tour itinerary is as follows: - Pick-up from your hotel (additional charges may apply if hotel is not located within central Tokyo) - Visit University of Tokyo Hongo Campus. The campus is one of the most beautiful in Japan and is especially picturesque during autumn when hundreds of Gingko Trees around the campus turn yellow in color. Have a pleasant stroll and see not only the autumn leaves but also the historical structures in the campus - Pass-by Ichounamiki Avenue, a well-known ginkgo tree-lined boulevard which leads to the Olympic Stadium - the main venue of Tokyo Olympics 2020. - Proceed to Yoyogi Park, one of the most famous parks in the city the turns into a forest of red and yellow during late November. - Visit Gotokuji Temple. This off the beaten path destination is unknown to most tourist but is one of the best places in Tokyo to see red and golden maple leaves - Visit Hibiya Park, Japan's first western style park featuring 51 types of trees donated from each of the prefecture across Japan. See their full beauty as the colors change during autumn. At certain times, a chrysanthemum flower display is also held at the park. After visiting Hibiya Park, proceed to Marunouchi to see the evening illuminations. *** Important Information *** 1) Itinerary may be subject to change depending on local conditions. 2) Condition of the autumn foliage is not guaranteed as weather can affect this. The typical best viewing time is from Late November to Early December. 3) This tour is available from November 15 to December 10
strTitle: See 5 of the best autumn spots in Tokyo in a private tour

strIntroduction: Enjoy a full-day of exploring Tokyo - from its traditional temples to its modern architecture. Comfortable coach transportation will enable you to visit many areas of this expansive city, whilst still being ensured that you have plenty of time to walk around and take in each site. Your knowledgeable & licensed tour guide is fluent in English and will be able to answer questions you have about Japan, Tokyo, and its people. The tour guide is also knowledgeable regarding Tokyo's unique architecture and will give you highlights of the history and inspiration behind the designs of many of Tokyo's famous buildings. Your guide will pick you up from the hotel, and your day will begin at the Zojoji Temple, which is one of the most popular Buddhist temples amongst locales. This iconic temple features Japan's traditional style of architecture, and is particularly photogenic because of its juxtaposition with the modern Tokyo Tower behind it. The tour will continue over to the Tokyo Bay, where you will visit the Fuji Sankei Building located on the man-made island "Odaiba" – a must-see area of Tokyo. Next, you will stop by Omotesando & Aoyama, an upscale area popular among younger generations. The area has been likened to the Champs Elysées avenue in Paris, and it features a number of flagship stores and unique buildings, including TOD'S and the Prada Boutique Aoyama, a gorgeous building that demands attention with its unique, stacked-block appearance. You will then relocate to the Ginza area (known for it's high-end shopping and luxury), where you will break for lunch at a stylish restaurant. While traveling through Ginza we will explore buildings such as Shiseido Ginza (Japan's top cosmetic brand) which is famous for its environmental consideration, earthquake-resistant features, and see-through metal exterior, as well as the must-see Maison Hermes building which was inspired by the Japanese lantern. Finally, the tour will relocate to the Tokyo Station area, situated in one of the most important business areas in Tokyo. Here you will explore the impressive International Forum in Marunouchi, which was modeled after a ship! After the tour concludes, you can take you back to your hotel (please make a request during your reservation), although it is recommended that you take your time and explore the Nakadori street after the tour. The area includes interesting destinations like the Mitsubishi Museum, and there are many delicious restaurants to be found in the Marunouchi Building. This area is where many Japanese businessmen and women enjoy their time after work.
strTitle: Tour Tokyo's Modern & Traditional Architecture Highlights

strIntroduction: Your translator guide will pick you up at your hotel and bring you to the training dōjō in Ginza. After you meet the sword-master, you will be instructed in how to put on the traditional kimono worn by samurai. The sword-master will explain and show you various swordplay techniques in the Iai-style of sword drawing, and correct your form as you try it for yourself. This style of swordplay focuses on the fast unsheathing techniques used to draw the sword and immediately disable your opponent. Your teacher is a 7th-level master swordsman in the Hisui-style of Iai, and he has done sword performances at many of the most important shrines in Japan (Ise Shrine, Meiji Shrine, Yasukuni Shrine, etc.) as well as other locations in Japan and throughout the world. You will also get the incredibly rare experience of "tameshigiri" – chopping up grass tatami mats with a real sword! After watching the master swordsman's demonstration you will get to attempt to cut the mat and compare your results. As you will learn in the lesson, when you have too many things on your mind, and when you try to be more than who you are, you will be unable to cut well. A major highlight of the lesson will be on concentration without thinking too much. The full lesson will be translated by your private guide, who will also translate any questions you may have for your instructor. After the lesson is over, you will be free to explore Ginza or travel wherever else you would like to in the city. Note: This activity uses real swords, so it is very important that all participants follow the sword-master's instructions. For safety reasons, some individuals (especially very active or inattentive children) may not be allowed to use the swords and participate in the mat cutting exercise. This decision remains with the sword-master, and we cannot refund any individuals who are not allowed to use the swords. We thank you in advance for your understanding.
strTitle: Private Katana Sword Iai Lesson with a Samurai Descendant

strIntroduction: You will be picked up at your hotel and brought to the restaurant. Once you arrive, your private experience will begin by meeting the master chefs and putting on the chef's apron and hat. The chefs who will guide you through the sushi-making process are all masters of their craft who trained diligently for many years before they were allowed to serve customers. You not only get to learn authentic sushi craftsmanship from a master chef, but you will also get the incredibly rare experience of actually stepping behind the sushi counter to make your creations from the point-of-view of a real chef. The friendly master chefs will guide you through making a number of different traditional "nigiri" sushi using the freshest of raw fish acquired earlier that day from the nearby Tsukiji fish market. Unlike much of the sushi found abroad, this is "real-deal" authentic sushi from a famous restaurant with almost a century of history behind it. You will finish by choosing one hand-roll to make (avocado, tuna or crab), and then you will move to a table to enjoy your creations, miso soup, and a couple of sushi pieces made by the master chef! During the meal the chef and your professional tour guide translator will explain to you the history of sushi, secrets of the trade and answer any questions you may have. In addition to the white chef's coat and hat, each of you will receive a fan, a traditional "yunomi" teacup, and a group photo to remember your experience. Note: This is an authentic experience which uses raw seafood. At the time of booking, you MUST notify the tour operator of any food allergies.
strTitle: Enjoy a Private Sushi Lesson with a Master Chef in Tsukiji

strIntroduction: I carry a fudepen and a postcard all the time, so that I can make Sachifude presents to people. Sachifude is a special type of rule-free calligraphy for writing nice messages. Numazu in Shizuoka is a countryside city in Japan. Most foreign visitors go to Tokyo, but the countryside is also very beautiful and I recommend visiting it too. If you arrive at Numazu or Mishima Station, I will pick up you by my small car (10-20 minute rde). You can enjoy the experience for about 1 hour at my home. You can drink Shizuoka green tea and learn Sachifude's history. Then use the Fudepen and practice Sachifude writing of your favorite Japanese character. Fainally, you can write your own post card. I'll give stamps for a postcard to your country. You can send it to your friends and take the Fudepen with you. This activity is available for 3 to 4 people maximum.
strTitle: Create your original work of Japanese Sachifude calligraphy

strIntroduction: Start your tour by walking through the busy streets of Shinjuku heading straight for Omoide Yokocho (literally “Memory Lane”) as our first stop. Omoide Yokocho is rightfully named as it is littered with rustic bars from the 1950s. Anyone of the older generation will feel as if they stepped back in time to the middle of the 20th century. Many of these bars still stay true to their roots, serving roasted giblets with beef and pork, which was a staple when food was scarce after World War II. From there we will make our way to Kabukicho, Asia’s largest, yet safest, red light district stopping at a kushikatsu stall for some authentic regional cuisine called kushikatsu (specialty food from Osaka of deep-fried skewered meat and vegetables). Each of our guests will get 4 kushikatsu and 1 drink. From here we will walk through the rest of Kabukicho, weaving in and out to give our guests a sense of its intoxicating atmosphere until we arrive at our second stop, a local eatery famous for highlighting the authentic regional flavors of southern Japan where guests will get to try 4 different dishes ranging from char grilled chicken, gyoza, chicken namba, miso and vegetables, yakisoba (grilled noodles, vegetables and meat), and cod roe with rice (menus change seasonally). After this, we move into Shinjuku’s Golden Gai neighborhood known for being Tokyo’s most popular spot for unique izakaya, bar stall and pub nightlife. A glimpse back to what Tokyo was like during the early and middle of the 20th century, Golden Gai locations are so densely packed you can almost be in two places at once (one foot in each). Despite is run-down appearance, Golden Gai generally attracts well-off clientele and their prices match accordingly with it being one of the most expensive places to drink in the city. Golden Gai is filled with over 200 small pubs, stalls, and karaoke bars where most are only big enough for five to seven people. Boasting the most densely packed nightlight area in the world, unique in every stall measured in inches rather than feet, Golden Gai will be a glimmer of Tokyo you will never forget and we look forward to having a cold-one with you in this historic place. This tour covers all food costs, 1 drink at kushikatsu and 1 drink at Golden Gai. We require a minimum of 2 travelers for the tour. If you are 1 traveler please contact us.
strTitle: Enjoy a Golden Gai Food Tour in Shinjuku at Night

strIntroduction: You will be able to experience a traditional tea ceremony and writing in Japanese calligraphy. Shodo: Using the “Fude” or brush, you can write your favorite “Kanji” or Japanese characters. After practicing with the basic “Kanji” you can challenge yourself to write more challenging characters! You can take home your writing as a souvenier. Matcha: We will make your “Matcha” or Japanese green tea right in front of your eyes. You will enjoy “Wagashi” or traditional Japanese confections and green tea as part of your Japanese experience. Schedule: ・10:00 start →10:05 shodo→10:35 matcha→11:00 finish ・13:00 start →13:05 shodo→13:35 matcha→14:00 finish ・15:00 start →15:05 shodo→15:35 matcha→16:00 finish Highlights: ・You can sit down on a chair and enjoy “Matcha”. ・You will not only drink Matcha but also make Matcha. ・Children over the age of 12 are required to pay regular price. ・Just 5 minutes away from Tokyo Metro Ginza Station.
strTitle: Discover Japan's traditional tea and calligraphy in Ginza

strIntroduction: Sugamo is an area located north of central Tokyo. It is well-known as Grandma’s Harajuku in comparison to the Harajuku's status as a center of Japanese youth culture and fashion. The Sugamo district retains the old downtown feel of traditional Japan. You can make for an interesting break from Tokyo’s usual pace. In this tour you will visit the district in 3 to 4 hours. I will pick you up at your hotel or we will meet up at Sugamo Station (JR or Mita Subway Line). The tour will start at 10:00 am. First, we will go to the Jizo-dori shooping street. There are almost no big chain stores and instead you will see a lot of unique independent shops, cafes, bakeries and restaurants. The delicacies of the street will surely thrill. A popular traditional sweet is called shio daifuku, which is a sweet azuki bean paste wrapped in soft, slightly salted mochi (sticky rice cake) skin. There are rows of shops selling other variety of sweets and snacks. Totally spoilt for choice. And we will also visit to Koganji Temple halfway down the shopping street. After that, we will go to lunch at Tokiwa-Shokudoh. Various Japanese home style foods are provided at reasonable price (usually less than 1000 JPY per plate). We will wrap up our tour about 02:00 pm at either JR Sugamo Station or JR Otsuka Station (next station from Sugamo). *Options: If you want to take a bath in a hot spring, we can go to the spa facility, Somei-Onsen Sakura. Rates Entrance fee is 1300 JPY (Children aged 3 to 12: 750 JPY). You can pay rental charges for towel and leisure wear worn inside the facilities. If you want to experience a local transportation, we will use the Toei Bus or the Toei Streetcar Arakawa Line around the Sugamo district (200 JPY). Inclusions: Included only guide fee. Drink and food, shopping cost are NOT included. Please pay for host's lunch meal during the tour. If you want pick-up service, host's transportation fee is included. But your transportation fees aren't. If you want to add spa option, please pay for host's entrance fee as well as yours. If you have any questions about my tour, please contact with me anytime!
strTitle: Explore the elderly people's paradise Sugamo, walking tour

strIntroduction: Feel the spirit and history of Edo in Kagurazaka After meeting at Keio Plaza Hotel, Tochomae Station or Shinjuku Station, the tour guide will take participants to Kagurazaka by train. *Please note that seating is not guaranteed. The guide will take participants through the busy shopping areas on Omote-dori street, and past the many refined restaurants tucked away in the alleys, as well as the stone-paved geisha quarter. Kagurazaka has been an area that has flourished for 150 years as a geisha district. While walking down the stone-paved streets with the guide, ponder what the lives of local people might have been like years ago. The tour route includes several famous temples and shrines: Tokyo Daijingu Shrine, Ushigome Mitsuke & Ushigomebashi Bridge, Kagurazaka-dori, Zenkoku-ji Temple. As well as Atamiyu Stairs, Kagurazaka Wakamiyahachiman Shrine, Koguri Yokocho, Kenban, Geisha Shindo etc. Then you will drop by a long-established izakaya bar filled with a Japanese atmosphere and enjoy a glass of refreshing drink and some snacks. When the tour ends in the evening, you are free to explore the district's nightlife or head to your next destination on your own. Time: 14:00 - 17:00 *Available on Sunday, Tuesday, Thursday this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Explore Street food and Bars in Kagurazaka!

strIntroduction: Experience Japanese Culture with your five senses! First check-in to the venue 10 mins prior to the starting time and enter the shop into a world of Japanese gastronomy! With around thirty seats, the shop incorporates a modern design alongside warmth and lighting achieved through use of articles like antique Japanese furnishings, ancient tree-wood and books. We've created a casual space for customers featuring a sort of Kyoto-esque serenity.. In the daytime, customers can enjoy what we call the Japanese Culinary Experience and Japanese Cafe Experience. In the evening, customers can reserve a table enjoy some Japanese dishes, along with carefully selected Japanese sake(Japanese liqueur). Choose out of 5 options, depending on what you want to learn, cook and eat. ・Sushi Class《11:00 or 16:00 start》 Menu (1 hour 10 mins): 1. Explain about what sushi is 2. Extract dashi(broth) 3. Make sushi vinegar and sushi rice 4. Make miso soup 5. Make sushi 6. Tea 7. ITADAKIMASU (Let’s eat!!) ・Okonomiyaki, Yakitori Class《11:00 or 16:00 start 》 Menu (1 hour 10 mins): 1. Explain what yakitori is 2. Skewer yakitori 3. Roast yakitori 4. Finish yakitori 5. Make okonomiyaki batter 6. Bake okonomiyaki 7. Explain what okonomiyaki is 8. Finish okonomiyaki 9. Tea 10.ITADAKIMASU (Let’s eat!!) ・Japanese cafe class 《Matcha / start time: 10:30- / 14:00- / 16:00-》 *Please input preferred time when you make a reservation. Menu(40 mins): 1. Explain the tea 2. Explain about tools and how to use 3. Make tea 4. Drink tea 5. How to use chasen 6. Japanese dessert 7. Let's eat!! *Participant under 16 must be with a parent and adult price will be charged for all options. *The store is closed on Tuesday. this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Try cooking Japanese Food in Asakusa!

strIntroduction: Experience dressing in a full kimono or samurai set and take a picture in them! While usually renting an actual, full kimono set will cost you big time and money, we’re offering you a cheaper alternative with the full experience in Asakusa Tokyo! You'll get to pick a kimono/samurai outfit of your choice, have a professional dress you up properly, take some photos in your outfits, and take those photos home with you. This experience is provided by the Kenbu Tachibana Ittoryu, which is a sword dance guild and has 80 long years of performance history. Schedule: * Choose one of the time slots below. 10:00-11:00, 11:00-12:00, 12:00-13:00, 13:00-14:00 14:00-15:00, 15:00-16:00, 16:00-17:00 this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Wear a Japanese Kimono/Samurai set in Asakusa!

strIntroduction: Looking for a summer adventure? Inflatable SUP or Inflatable Stand Up Paddleboard is a great choice while admiring the beauty of Mount Fuji! This plan includes round trip bus service to Yamanaka Lake (available for reservation only). Please select your preferred date and time when you make a reservation. (Full payment for bus service must be paid before departure.) After checking in at Busta Shinjuku with your voucher, you will hop aboard the bus on your way to Yamanaka Lake. Once arriving at the Yamanakako Asahigaoka Bus terminal, you will transfer to the meeting point yourself. At the venue, our staff will give you a brief 30-minute lecture on everything you need to know about SUP. In this program, you have to understand correctly about how to operate and stand properly on the paddle board for maximum stability and control. But don't worry even if it's your first time. You will get the hang of it during the lecture and following tour. After the tour starts you will have about an hour and a half to enjoy the Inflatable SUP on Yamanaka Lake while enjoying the surrounding view of Mt. Fuji. －Please feel free to enjoy this experience! Fixed digital camera (CASIO EXILIM FR10) on SUP will capture your image. After the program had finished, you can bring the Micro-SD card home. This program is for 15yo or older. Schedule: Morning Session : 10:00 - 12:00 Afternoon Session: 14:00 - 16:00 meet-up at the venue is 10 mins prior for both sessions this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Enjoy Stand Up Paddleboard on Yamanaka Lake! (Bus Included)

strIntroduction: Book this bullet train package and enjoy visiting Kyoto and have an excellent stay at Kyoto's four-star hotel, Hotel Kintetsu Kyoto Station! Visit Kyoto's beautiful temples and explore the city to learn more about both the ancient and modern culture of Kyoto! Walk around Gion at night to see the beautiful lights of Yasaka Shrine and the Geisha! Hotel Kintetsu Kyoto Station a famous four-star hotel located in downtown Kyoto. Located in a very strategic area, the hotel has many access to various sightseeing spots of Kyoto, making the transportation extremely convenient. The hotel designer combined both the modern and the classic Japanese style for the interior, and the hotel displays many Kyoto-themed artworks. The design and the artworks enhances the atmosphere of the hotel and provides an immersive experience of Kyoto to the visitors. The guestrooms are equipped with sophisticated furniture, fine bedding and linens, and stylish clean bathroom. LAN and WiFi is available in all guest rooms and lobby area. You can visit Kyoto's famous sightseeing spots, which are as follows: - Kinkaku-ji Temple Kinkaku-ji is Kyoto's most famous sightseeing spot and iconic sight. It is famous for its 'Golden Pavilion'. The temple is located in the middle of a pond, ant you can see the clear reflection of the temple on the surface of the pond. - Ginkaku-ji Temple Ginkaku-ji temple has enormous halls and magnificent gardens, which also has a tremendous sand garden in the middle of the temple. Ginkaku-ji is famous for its 'Silver Pavilion'. - Kiyomizu-dera Temple Kiyoizu-dera Temple is one of Kyoto's most famous sightseeing spots, which are always crowded for the whole year. Many people visit Kiyomizu-dera Temple to see the view of Kyoto city from the top of the temple, which is very beautiful. - Gion Gion is Kyoto's most famous Geisha district, and it has many top notch restaurants and izakayas. Indeed, some of the restaurants are awarded Michelin Stars for its quality. The schedule for the tour is as follows: - Day 1 6:00 - 6:55 Transfer to Tokyo station or Shinagawa station on your own. 6:00 - 6:55 Depart to Kyoto station with Nozomi Shinkansen (fastest bullet train). 8:02 - 9:08 Arrive at Kyoto Station - Day 2 Free time - Day 3 Free time until departure 13:10 – 15:50 Transfer to Kyoto Station on your own. 13:10 – 15:50 Depart to Tokyo station or Shinagawa station with Nozomi Shinkansen (fastest bullet train) 15:30 – 18:20 Arrive at Tokyo station or Shinagawa station. ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Standard Ticket Delivery Ticket delivery is included in the price of your ticket. We will deliver the tickets to your hotel, and the tickets will be available for pickup from your hotel concierge when you check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We need at least 3 business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if we don't get your hotel information soon enough, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office unless you book the optional ""Same Day Delivery Service to Tokyo Hotels"" service (described below). - If you are not staying at a hotel, you are required to pickup the tickets from our office. 2. Optional: Same Day Delivery Service to Tokyo Hotels We offer same day ticket delivery to central Tokyo hotels if the booking is placed before 17:00 JST. The same day delivery service is only available to hotels with a concierge. The tickets will be delivered to your hotel within 3 hours of us accepting your order; please note that this does not mean the tickets are delivered within 3 hours of you placing your order. If you are interested in the same day delivery service, please also book the ""Same Day Delivery Service to Tokyo Hotels"" option with your tickets. 3. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 6 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station. Address: (English) Miyamasu ON Building 5th floor, 1-15-8 Shibuya, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo (Japanese) 〒150-0002 東京都渋谷区渋谷 1-15-8 宮益 ON ビル 5F Detailed Directions (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/shibuya-station-to-voyagin-office Google Map (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/voyagin-google-map This activity is provided by HIS
strTitle: 2 Nights Stay at Hotel Kintetsu Kyoto(Early Tokyo Departure)

strIntroduction: Wara village is hidden deep in a mountain valley between Gero and Gujo cities in Gifu prefecture. Here you will not only be able to discover nostalgic images of rural landscape with plenty of rice paddies and corn fields, but you will also see how local people in Japan live their ordinary lives. This will be a unique experience from your trip to Japan! Wara is known for its rivers and freshwater activities. Wara is home to the protected giant salamanders that can be easily seen in the water in August. But more than anything else, Wara is known for the Ayu sweetfish. Plenty of Japanese people come from far away to experience sweetfish fishing and to taste the delicious fish after grilling it on fire with salt. This is exactly the activity that you will try in Wara! Period of the activity: Only between June 15 and August 15 You will be given rental equipment for sweetfish fishing. After fishing, you will be join local people in grilling the fish with salt on fire and eat it! This activity lasts about 3 hours and starts at 10:00 or at 13:00. Note: For an additional 2000 JPY local people can prepare a delicious lunch for you! You can reach Wara village by bus from Gujo city. Alternatively, you can reach it by changing two buses from Hida-Kanayama village as well.
strTitle: Enjoy Ayu sweetfish fishing in the rural village Wara, Gifu

strIntroduction: Wara village in Gifu prefecture is one of the most picturesque hidden rural places in Japan. Located in a valley between the mountains that separate Gujo and Gero cities, Wara has the atmosphere of unspoiled rural beauty that will fascinate the hearts of all visitors. In this village you can not only see nostalgic images of a pastoral landscape, but you can actively interact with the friendly locals and engage in many seasonal activities. Your visit to Wara will be unlike any other experience in Japan and you will have the true opportunity to discover rural life in its most genuine form! Below is the list of seasonal activities you can enjoy in Wara. Please note that you can do only the activity listed under the period of your visit: April 1 - June 9: Cycling around Wara's highlights (which include a brilliant Buddhist Temple with the village's treasure - a legendary demon skull, a spiritual Shinto shrine with unique rock formations, local shops, a small museum of folklore, and more) June 10 - June 25: Firefly watching in the forest June 26 - July 31: Cycling around Wara's highlights (see above) August 1 - August 30: Riverside fun and salamander watching September 1 - September 30: Cycling around Wara's highlights (see above) October 1 - October 31: Harvesting local vegetables and eating them November 1 - March 31: Practicing nose flute playing with local people The starting time is either 10:00 or 13:00, except for the firefly watching which starts from 19:00. Each activity takes about 2 hours to complete. Note: For an additional 2000 JPY per person the local people will prepare a delicious lunch for you! You can reach Wara village by bus from Gujo city. Alternatively, you can reach it by changing two buses from Hida-Kanayama village as well.
strTitle: Try rural activities in the nostalgic Wara village, Gifu

strIntroduction: This activity will transport you to a nostalgic past where people live in a simple way surrounded by beautiful nature and eco-friendly products in one of the most picturesque villages in rural Japan! Welcome to Maze village, hidden in the heart of Gifu prefecture! Spend a day in the pastoral landscape of Maze village and forget about the hassle of the big towns. Enjoy plenty of old-fashioned craft activities and communicate with the hospitable village people! Below is the schedule of the tour: 9:00: Pick up from JR Hida-Hagiwara Station by car 9:30: Start the day by a guided walk around the open-air eco museum town of Maze. See farms, gardens and old houses, and eat fresh tomatoes cooling in river water 12:00: Enter the local charcoal maker's house to interact with local people and eat a delicious lunch prepared by them 13:30: Make a "kokedama" bonsai art or "goheimochi" local sweets together with local people 14:30: You will be sent off to JR Hida-Hagiwara Station where the tour ends Don't miss the opportunity to experience the local lifestyle of Maze village and meet its wonderful and friendly local people! Note: This tour needs to be booked at least 2 weeks in advance. Available only on weekdays between April and November. Public holidays excluded.
strTitle: Enjoy rural activities in the nostalgic village Maze, Gifu

strIntroduction: This activity will transport you to a nostalgic past where people live in a simple way surrounded by beautiful nature and eco-friendly products in one of the most picturesque villages in rural Japan! Welcome to Maze village, hidden in the heart of Gifu prefecture! You will enter Maze from Wara village in the neighbouring Gujo city. Please access Wara yourself from Gujo bus terminal by local bus. You will then spend two wonderful days in Maze before finishing the tour at JR Hida-Hagiwara Station along the JR Takayama line. Below is the schedule of this tour: Day 1 16:00: Pick-up from Wara village by car 17:00: Check in at Miki no Sato hotel 17:00-17:50: Enjoy the hot springs of the hotel facility 18:00: Move to Mizube no Yakata, a wonderful local riverside restaurant and have dinner at the river watching the bonfire 20:00: Return back to Miki no Sato for overnight stay Day 2 9:00: Start the day by a guided walk around the open-air eco museum town of Maze. See farms, gardens and old houses, and eat fresh tomatoes cooling in river water 11:30: Enter the local charcoal maker's house to interact with local people and eat a delicious lunch prepared by them 13:00: Make a "kokedama" bonsai art or "goheimochi" local sweets together with local people 14:30: You will be sent off to JR Hida-Hagiwara Station where the tour ends Don't miss the opportunity to experience the local lifestyle of Maze village and meet its wonderful and friendly local people! Note: This tour needs to be booked at least 2 weeks in advance. Available only on weekdays between April and November. Public holidays excluded.
strTitle: Explore the rural paradise Maze in a 2-day trip from Gujo

strIntroduction: This is a unique activity in which you will see all steps from picking the green tea to serving it at the tea ceremony. Moreover, you will participate in many stages of this process, surrounded by the ambience of the historical heritage of the Nagao Residence. This activity takes place in the rural village of Hida-Kanayama, in Gifu prefecture. First, you will visit one of the family branch houses of the Nagao Residence and will learn more about its history and the origin of the high-quality "Ikusato" green tea that was delivered from Hida-Kanayama village directly to the court in Kyoto during the Edo period. You will pick green tea yourself from the tea plantation behind the residence using a bamboo basket. Inside the house, you will witness the ancient ways of brewing green tea in a large pot over firewood. You will be fascinated to see that fresh water is pumped up directly from the well. Not only tea, but green tea mochi rice sweets will also be baked in the backyard of the house. You will make your own wooden utensil for cutting the sweets that are served together with green tea. Finally, you will be able to enjoy the green tea with sweets in the tatami room of the historical residence, in an atmosphere which has preserved the authentic spirit of the ancient times. This is a unique way to experience the traditions of green tea in Japan from the beginning till the end! The activity lasts about 4 hours and begins from 13:30 pm.
strTitle: Pick green tea & brew it by ancient methods, Hida-Kanayama!

strIntroduction: Hida-Kanayama is a small village in Gero prefecture whose central area can be easily explored on foot on the peculiar "Kinkotsu-meguri" tour. You will walk with a knowledgeable guide through a maze of narrow back streets that have always been used as public pathways by the local people. Along the way you will see many unique sights, such as wells and canals of running valley water, some of which are used as public washing places, while others are storing freshwater eel waiting to be delivered to high-class restaurants around Japan. You will also enter several of the village's historical buildings, such as the former bath house and the former silk cocoon factory, where you will discover how people from the past lived in the old days. Among the highlights of this guided walk are the visits to plenty of local food shops, including a tofu factory, a shop for Japanese sweets and a nostalgic tempura restaurant. The tour will end with a visit to a traditional sake brewery that will fascinate you with its collection of antiques and delicious sake for trying! This tour takes about 1 hour and a half to complete on foot. The tour is available until 15:00 pm.
strTitle: Explore the narrow streets & local shops of Hida-Kanayama

strIntroduction: Let this trip be your creative outlet as we feel, learn and practice the Japanese classic art forms of Ukiyo-e and Mokuhan-ga (woodblock printing). First, we’ll meet at Meiji-Jingumae Station (in Harajuku) and take a 15-minute train ride to Fureai-kan. Once there, we’ll introduce ourselves to our artist and host for the day. Our host, an accomplished woodcut tattooist, will share how he got his start in the world of this beautiful craft. Then we’ll learn about Ukiyo-e, a genre of art that became popular during Japan’s Edo period. You’ll get to learn, touch and browse Ukiyo-e prints up close for a deeper look at this craft. Our host will explain in detail the mechanics of Ukiyo-e woodblock printing so that you can produce your own. Even if you’re a complete beginner to this kind of art, the host is more than happy to guide you in recreating beautiful prints for yourself. There will also be a translator so that you can ask any questions and enjoy working directly with the artist. Once the tour is finished, we’ll see an exclusive performance and wood-cutting style to wrap up a truly unique tour through Japanese art! DATES: Every First and Third Tuesday/Thursday SCHEDULE: 2:30 PM Meet at Meiji-Jingumae Station 3:00 PM Arrive at Furei-Kan 3:00 PM-3:20 PM Introductions and overview from the host (including details about the host and their background) 3:20 PM–3:50 PM Overview of Ukiyo-e (viewing and touching the woodblock prints) 4:00 PM-5:30 PM Painting and recreating your own woodblock prints! 5:30 PM Special wood-cutting performance 6:00 PM Departure DURATION: 2:30-6:30 PM, Approximately 4 hours
strTitle: Sensual Immersion in the Art of Japanese Woodblock Printing

strIntroduction: This tour will give you a chance to learn, cook and taste a variety of Japanese foods with a Japanese chef. To start, we’ll head to a greengrocer and scope out a variety of vegetables and produce that normally are not available outside of Japan. If there’s something that catches your eye, this is your chance to pick out an interesting food item and learn the best way to prepare it with the chef. Then, we’ll watch the chef demonstrate a few recipes and imitate his steps. If you’re a beginner to Japanese cuisine, don’t worry. This pro chef has had plenty of practice sharing the tricks that make each recipe easy to follow. At the end, you’ll have mastered a Japanese-style rolled omelet, deep fried tofu and vegetables, onigiri, and an array of other dishes. Plus, they’ll taste even better after knowing you made them yourself! Dates: Available upon request Schedule: 10:30 AM Meet at Meiji-Jingu-mae Station 11:00 AM Arrive at the Ya-ne-sen (from first syllable of the three areas YAnaka, NEzu, and SENdagi) district of Tokyo and visit the nearby greengrocer to select vegetables 11:30 AM Begin the cooking session 11:30 AM-12:00 PM Observe how an expert cook, or Itamae cooks 12:00 PM-12:30 PM Prepare shrimp 12:30 PM-2:00 PM Cook a Japanese rolled omelet 2:15 PM-2:45 PM Cook deep-fried tofu and vegetables 2:45 PM-3:30 PM Make onigiri 3:30 PM-4:00 PM Eat together with a Q&A Duration: 10:30 - 4:30, approximately six hours
strTitle: Become an Apprentice to a Japanese Chef for a Day

strIntroduction: First, we’ll meet at the TABICA office in Harajuku, then leave together for the farm. It takes about one hour. We’ll meet with the farmers, and they will tell stories about their life abroad and how they got their start as farmers. As fellow travelers, we expect there will be lots of interesting episodes and experiences to share. You’ll also enjoy a guided tour around the farm, get a glimpse of nearby temples, and take in beautiful views of the mountain landscape surrounding the farm. The hosts will then take you in for a taste of the "omotenashi" spirit: they will offer tea, Japanese perilla drinks, and a light lunch. To end the day, we’ll take some time learning how to make "takabue", bamboo flutes. This is a traditional handmade craft that Japanese people learn to make as children. We believe that in these few hours away from Tokyo, you'll achieve a sense of calm and relaxation as well as enjoy the music from your new flute. Date: Every Monday, Tuesday, and Friday Schedule: 12:00 - Meet at our office in Harajuku 13:00 - 14:00 Ice-breaking and tour of the farm 14:00 - 14:30 Tea break 14:30 - 15:30 "Takebue" bamboo flute making 15:40 - 16:00 Post-activity open discussion and group picture Duration: 3 hours
strTitle: Make a Bamboo Flute in a Japanese Farm

strIntroduction: In this tour, our guide from Tokyo Flour Mania will guide you through bakeries and Japanese traditional spots in the Yanaka/Ueno area, “Shitamachi” (literally “low city”) district of Tokyo where lots of historical Japanese culture is still left. We will visit a bakery (Atom) in the shopping street named "Yanaka Ginza" at first. Then, we will move to Ueno area and split up at Ueno Street. Below is the list of bakeries we will visit. ・Atom The shop name comes from “Mighty Atom” or “Astro Boy” which is a famous manga character that the owner really likes. Astro Boy figures and framed drawings line the shop and customers can buy Astro Boy-themed goods, along with the bread. We will be tasting bread baked in a special oven made from lava from Mt. Fuji. ・Kayaba Bakery They started in 2015 as Kayaba Coffee’s sister shop. One of the unique features of his bakery is its architecture, as it was converted from a kominka, a traditional Japanese house. We will be enjoying bread made from domestic (Japanese) flour and raisin yeast. ・Iacoppé This is a sister’s shop of “BOULANGERIE ianak!” which is located in Nishi-Nippori and specializes in bakery that sells sandwiches made of koppe pan, bread similar to hot dog buns. Koppe pan was once served as part of school lunches in the Showa era, but recently specialized koppe pan bakeries have cropped up as a resurgence and a reinterpretation of this nostalgic bread. They started in 2014. ** We will be sharing one popular bread from each bakery. We will be tasting three kinds of bread in total. Please feel free to purchase any other breads on your own. ** We are planning on walking, but there is the option to take the bus. If the bus option is preferred, please note that bus transportation is not included in the cost of the tour. We might be able to accept special requests, but our regular time slots for the tour are: Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday (10:30 - 12:30/ 13:00-15:00) Please wear comfortable clothes and shoes for walking.
strTitle: Discover hidden bakeries on a Bakery Tour in Yanaka & Ueno!

Change clothes. ↓ It takes 10 minutes to reach the Blue Cave by boat. ↓ Enjoy your snorkeling time. ↓ Back to port. ※It takes approximately 2 hours in total.
